problems.problem: A 2 kg ball moves at $3\,\text{m/s}$. Calculate its momentum.
problems.final_answer: The momentum of the ball is $6\,\text{kg·m/s}$.

problems.problem: A 5 kg object initially at rest is hit, giving it a velocity of $4\,\text{m/s}$. Find its change in momentum.
A $0.15\,\text{kg}$ baseball moving at $30\,\text{m/s}$ is caught, bringing it to rest. Calculate the impulse delivered.
problems.final_answer: The impulse delivered is $4.5\,\text{N·s}$ (direction opposite to motion).

problems.problem: A car of mass $1000\,\text{kg}$ moving at $20\,\text{m/s}$ comes to a stop in $5\,\text{s}$. Find the average force exerted on the car.
problems.final_answer: The average force exerted is $4000\,\text{N}$ opposite to motion.

problems.problem: Two ice skaters push off each other. Skater A has mass $50\,\text{kg}$ and moves at $2\,\text{m/s}$. Skater B has mass $70\,\text{kg}$. Find B's velocity.

step_by_step.explanation: Total initial momentum = 0, so $m_A v_A + m_B v_B = 0$

problems.final_answer: Skater B moves at $1.43\,\text{m/s}$ opposite to A.

problems.problem: A 0.2 kg ball hits a wall at $15\,\text{m/s}$ and bounces back at $12\,\text{m/s}$. Find the impulse on the ball.
problems.final_answer: Impulse delivered to the ball is $5.4\,\text{N·s}$ opposite to initial motion.

problems.problem: A truck of mass $2000\,\text{kg}$ moving at $10\,\text{m/s}$ collides and comes to rest in $2\,\text{s}$. Calculate the average force.
problems.final_answer: Average force is $10000\,\text{N}$ opposite to motion.

problems.problem: A 0.5 kg cart moving at $4\,\text{m/s}$ is stopped in $0.2\,\text{s}$. Find the impulse and force.
problems.final_answer: Impulse is $2\,\text{N·s}$ and force is $10\,\text{N}$ opposite to motion.

problems.problem: A 3 kg ball moving at $6\,\text{m/s}$ collides elastically with a stationary 2 kg ball. If the collision is head-on and perfectly elastic, find the velocity of the first ball after collision.
problems.final_answer: Velocity of the first ball after collision is $1.2\,\text{m/s}$.

problems.problem: A $0.1\,\text{kg}$ ball moving at $10\,\text{m/s}$ strikes a wall and rebounds at $-10\,\text{m/s}$. Calculate the impulse delivered to the wall.
problems.final_answer: Impulse delivered to the wall is $2\,\text{N·s}$ opposite to initial motion.
